TopicTitle: What resolution do you play KSP at?

Articles.Content:
1920x1080.

It's hard for me to even imagine turning it down (even if it lags).

1600 x 1200. Using one of the dual monitors.

I can't even find monitors with this resolution anymore.

Happy landings!
Fullscreen 2560 x 1440. After going full res, I can't go back...

1360 x 768

Best my system can do...

1366x768, fullscreen.

I use a laptop.
Feels kind of lonely being the only one running 3840x2160.
1920x1200, my monitor's native resolution.
A funny one, 1280 X 1024.
I'm surprised 1280x1024 is so rare. It was once among the most common resolutions and I'd have thought more people had those monitors still around.
Three 1920x1080 monitors, running with Nvidia surround at 5760x1080.

I run it on 1600x900 when I want it to be pretty, but when I wanna record I turn it down to 1368 by 768. Gives me a massive boost in performance, allowing me to run the recording program and KSP with no lag.
I play at 1920x1080 fullscreen. @Voculus, wow! IVA must be insane!

I'm surprised 1280x1024 is so rare. It was once among the most common resolutions and I'd have thought more people had those monitors still around.

Yeah, it used to be pretty common. But since it was a 5:4 pixel ratio, in a 4:3 screen ratio, everything was always slightly distorted. I think that's why it fell out of favor.

I'm curious as to what resolution people play KSP at. I myself play at 1280x1024 with a Dell 1707FP.

If your option is "Other", please let me know so you can be included in the data.

Feel free to move this thread to the right location if needed.

Another SXGA 5:4 user. I'm in tears. I thought I was all alone.

Yeah, it used to be pretty common. But since it was a 5:4 pixel ratio, in a 4:3 screen ratio, everything was always slightly distorted. I think that's why it fell out of favor.

It was distorted on CRTs, but the common 1280x1024 LCDs had square pixels. I think it fell out of favor for the same reason as all the 4:3 ratios: Widescreen took over everything.

1920x1080, which is the preferred resolution of my gaming laptop's screen. Also, it's what YouTube likes and samples down nicely to other common video sizes. It looks surprisingly well at 720p and I can usually still read all the little text.

When I do testing for Near Future or for personal tweaks, I use window-mode at 1680x1050 so I can still easily switch to my Excel spreadsheets, configs, file explorer and the forums.

But when I actually play the game, I run fullscreen at 1920x1200.
I play at 1920x1080p given that my "monitor" is a Sony Bravia TV and that is its highest resolution.
3840X2160 Play very little of KSP now but that might change with 64 bit and when I can use all my RAM Been play a lot of the Witcher 3 and GTA V recently

It was distorted on CRTs, but the common 1280x1024 LCDs had square pixels. I think it fell out of favor for the same reason as all the 4:3 ratios: Widescreen took over everything.

With CRT its easier with an square screen, Then moving to flat panels it was naturally to go wider for TV and it stuck for monitors too. I would actually prefer an even wider screen as it would eliminate the need of two screens and can be used for gaming wile taking up less room than an 3 screen setup.
